meanings.definition: The property of a material to increase in volume when subjected to shear stress.
meanings.sent1: The dilatancy of the soil caused it to expand under pressure.
meanings.sent2: The dilatancy of the sponge was evident when squeezed tightly.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's dilatancy made it grow bigger when blown up.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement had a dilatancy effect on her smile, making it wider.
meanings.sent5: The dilatancy of the dough as it rose in the oven was fascinating to watch.

meanings.sent1: The dilatancy of the liquid was noticeable as it flowed slowly.
meanings.sent2: The dilatancy of the crowd made it difficult to move through.
meanings.sent3: The dilatancy of the situation added a sense of suspense to the room.
meanings.sent4: The dilatancy of time seemed to stretch out endlessly during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The dilatancy of the rubber band was evident as it expanded when pulled.
